sections.name: Ancient Skaveling
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Chaotic
traits.text: Chaotic effects often manipulate energy from chaos-aligned Outer Planes and are anathema to lawful divine servants or divine servants of lawful deities. A creature with this trait is chaotic in alignment.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Undead
traits.text: Once living, these creatures were infused after death with void energy and soul-corrupting unholy magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by vitality energy and are healed by void energy, and don’t benefit from healing vitality effects.

interaction_abilities.name: Echolocation
interaction_abilities.text: The ancient skaveling can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

ability.name: Bone-Shattering Screech

traits.name: Auditory
traits.text: Auditory actions and effects rely on sound. An action with the auditory trait can be successfully performed only if the creature using the action can speak or otherwise produce the required sounds. A spell or effect with the auditory trait has its effect only if the target can hear it. This applies only to sound-based parts of the effect, as determined by the GM. This is different from a sonic effect, which still affects targets who can’t hear it (such as deaf targets) as long as the effect itself makes sound.

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature’s emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Fear
traits.text: Fear effects evoke the emotion of fear. Effects with this trait always have the mental and emotion traits as well.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

traits.name: Necromancy
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the necromancy school of magic, typically involving forces of life and death.

traits.name: Occult
traits.text:
This magic comes from the occult tradition, calling upon bizarre and ephemeral mysteries. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to occult magic.

traits.name: Sonic
traits.text: An effect with the sonic trait functions only if it makes sound, meaning it has no effect in an area of silence or in a vacuum. This is different from an auditory spell, which is effective only if the target can hear it. A sonic effect might deal sonic damage.

ability.critical_success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Bone-Shattering Screech for 24 hours.
ability.success: The creature takes half damage and is frightened 1.
ability.failure: The creature takes full damage and is frightened 2
ability.critical_failure: The creature takes double damage, is frightened 3, and is stunned 3.
ability.text: The ancient skaveling unleashes a devastating screech that not only chills the bones but shatters them. The screech can be heard throughout the region and alerts all creatures in the Hanging Castle. Creatures in a 20-foot emanation take 12d6 sonic damage and must attempt a DC 36 Will save. The ancient skaveling can't use Bone-Shattering Screech again for 1d4 rounds.

traits.name: Disease
traits.text: An effect with this trait applies one or more diseases. A disease is typically an affliction.

stages.name: Stage 1
stages.text: carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

stages.name: Stage 2
stages.text: 2d6 negative damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

stages.name: Stage 4
stages.text: 2d6 negative damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

stages.name: Stage 6
stages.text: dead, and rises as a ghoul the next midnight

ability.name: Paralysis

traits.name: Incapacitation
traits.text: An ability with this trait can take a character completely out of the fight or even kill them, and it’s harder to use on a more powerful character. If a spell has the incapacitation trait, any creature of more than twice the spell’s rank treats the result of their check to prevent being incapacitated by the spell as one degree of success better, or the result of any check the spellcaster made to incapacitate them as one degree of success worse. If any other effect has the incapacitation trait, a creature of higher level than the item, creature, or hazard generating the effect gains the same benefits.

traits.name: Necromancy
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the necromancy school of magic, typically involving forces of life and death.

traits.name: Occult
traits.text:
This magic comes from the occult tradition, calling upon bizarre and ephemeral mysteries. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to occult magic.

ability.failure: The creature is paralyzed. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each save.
ability.text: Any creature hit by the skaveling's Strikes must attempt a DC 36 Fortitude save.
